project.name: C-C124B-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01
project.description: Creating test case using base program. Added an environment variable read to get a key in order to read in data from shared memory. Completed injection.

build_commands.command: make install CC="$SS_CC" LD="$SS_LNK" CFLAGS="$CFLAGS" CPPFLAGS="$CPPFLAGS" LDFLAGS="$LDFLAGS" prefix="$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_INSTALL" LIBS="$LIBS"

iopair.name: C-C124B-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01-GOOD-01
iopair.description: Has a fixed heap buffer of size 64. (char [64])

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 5389 -s 596 -m "AAA" -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"
if [[ $(wc -c "$SS_LOG_EXECUTE_STDOUT" | cut -d " " -f 1) -eq $(wc -c "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_SCORE/good-01/output.txt" | cut -d " " -f 1) ]]; then echo "SIMILAR"; else echo "DIFFERENT"; fi;

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid") && echo "Killed shared memory server."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory server PID file does not exist."; fi

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id" ]]; then ipcrm -m $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id") && echo "Deleted shared memory segment."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory ID file does not exist."; fi

scoring_formula.formula: STDOUT-REPORT-01 AND STDOUT-CONTENT-LENGTH-01 AND NOT TIMEOUT AND NOT CONTROLLED_EXIT

iopair.name: C-C124B-CTRE-01-ST04-DT02-DF11-CF20-01-BAD-02
iopair.description: Has a fixed heap buffer of size 64. (char [64])

process.script: nohup shm_setup -k 5389 -s 596 -m "This is probably going to overflow a buffer of some sort. Let's run it anyway and see what happens. I hope that everything turns out ok, because I would love to see what this looks like in all CAPS. Converting ASCII characters to upper case is easy, you can either call a system function, or just add the standard difference between the start of the two character sets. But, I am sure there is a reason that system functions exist for this sort of functionality." -o /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.out 2>&1 & echo $! > /opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid && echo "Shared memory created"
if [[ $(wc -c "$SS_LOG_EXECUTE_STDOUT" | cut -d " " -f 1) -eq $(wc -c "$SS_TC_ROOT/$SS_TC_SCORE/good-04/output.txt" | cut -d " " -f 1) ]]; then echo "SIMILAR"; else echo "DIFFERENT"; fi;

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid" ]]; then killtree.sh -s 9 -p $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.pid") && echo "Killed shared memory server."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory server PID file does not exist."; fi

if [[ -f "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id" ]]; then ipcrm -m $(cat "/opt/stonesoup/workspace/inputDaemons/shared_memory_01.id") && echo "Deleted shared memory segment."; else echo "Failed: Shared memory ID file does not exist."; fi
